thread.title: Rookies seek opportunity with Ice Bears - News Sentinel
thread.title_full: Rookies seek opportunity with Ice Bears - News Sentinel Story

author: Dave Link
title: Rookies seek opportunity with Ice Bears - News Sentinel
text:
Josh Cousineau has an idea how the 16 rookies trying to make the Knoxville Ice Bears' roster were feeling Wednesday during their first day of training camp at Civic Coliseum.
Cousineau was one of them last year, made the team, and played a significant role as the Ice Bears won the Southern Professional Hockey League championship.
It's not the same situation this year for Cousineau, one of seven returnees from the 2014-15 roster.
"Last year was totally different," Cousineau said after the morning practice. "You come in here a little bit jittery. You don't know really how you stand, or if you're going to make it or not. After a couple of skates, though, you get some confidence out there."
Rookies have a short time to impress Knoxville coach Mike Craigen.
The Ice Bears practiced twice Wednesday, have two-a-days Thursday and Friday, and play exhibition games at home Saturday against Fayetteville and on the road Sunday against Mississippi.
The season opener is Oct. 23 at Macon.
Knoxville has 28 players in camp and must trim the roster to 22 by Monday.
"I think what you take away from that first practice is everybody realizes what kind of opportunity is here," Craigen said. "The rookies are excited to be here and have a chance to play for such a good franchise. The returning guys are excited to be part of a growing group. I think those guys are going to embrace a leadership role within that room."
Rookie defenseman Jake Flegel of Whitby, Ontario, sees the opportunity and challenge ahead.
Flegel played two years at NCAA Division III power Adrian College (Mich.) and was a teammate there in 2013-14 with Cousineau.
Flegel is one of five rookies in main camp who made the cut from last weekend's free-agent camp.
"It's a pro tryout, and obviously they're looking for guys to fill roster spots," Flegel said. "You've got to turn that nervous energy into excitement and confidence and go from there and play well."
Knoxville has had four players from Adrian College on its roster in recent years: Mike Towns, Jeremy Klaver, Andrew Dovey, and Cousineau.
Right wing Shawn Skelly, who also played for Adrian College, signed with the Ice Bears in the offseason. Skelly started his pro career in 2011-12 and has played in the SPHL and East Coast Hockey League for four seasons.
Flegel was aware of the pipeline from Adrian College to Knoxville.
"I obviously knew (Cousineau) was coming down here," Flegel said. "He was a great leader on my team. He's kind of a legend at Adrian College just because of the kind of guy he is and the leader he is in the dressing room, and really a likeable guy. Obviously him coming here and Skelly is here as well, I knew I was coming into a great organization."
Cousineau had 19 points (nine goals, 10 assists) in 41 regular-season games last season and two points (one goal, one assist) in seven playoff games.
His role should expand this year.
"It was hard to jump right up in the top two lines here last year because we had such a deep team," Cousineau said. "This year I'm looking forward to logging some more minutes and maybe a bit more power-play time, and hopefully put a few more in the net."
Dave Link is a freelance contributor.
